item.title: Working with Python
item.description: In the month that we as a class were working on Python, I found that the topic that I enjoyed the most is isolating specific phrases using regex (regular expression). Figuring it out how to isolate certain sections is like a puzzle, which is what I like most about Genetics and Genomics work (my focus in academics). It’s kind of like figuring out a pedigree - what’s an individual’s likely genotype given their phenotype and their relatives’ phenotypes, what’s the mode of inheritance, etc.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Introduction library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.0 -- ## <U+2713> ggplot2 3.2.1 <U+2713> purrr 0.3.3 ## <U+2713> tibble 2.1.3 <U+2713> dplyr 0.8.3 ## <U+2713> tidyr 1.0.0 <U+2713> stringr 1.4.0 ## <U+2713> readr 1.3.1 <U+2713> forcats 0.4.0 ## -- Conflicts ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() Dataset1 <- read.csv("C:/Users/rachel/Desktop/website/static/Part C Dataset.csv") Dataset2 <- read.csv("C:/Users/rachel/Desktop/website/static/Countries.csv") Dataset1 <- Dataset1 %>% na.omit() Dataset2 <- Dataset2 %>% na.

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Introduction The first dataset I chose was from by SDS 328M project. At the time, I was really into global inequality after taking a government course, Politics of Poverty. In the dataset, I randomly chose 64 countries and from the CIA World FactBook (https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/docs/profileguide.html) and looked up their GINI coefficient (which measures the amount of inequality), infant mortality, and GDP per capital (in US dollars). The second dataset from data.

item.title: Projects
item.description: INTRODUCTION Hi! My name is Rachel Dean and I'm currently a junior at the University of Texas at Austin. I was born in Orange County, CA and moved to Austin, TX when I was really young. I have a brother, Joseph, who also goes to UT Austin. He followed in our father's footsteps and is an Electrical Engineering (EE) major and plans to get his Ph.D in the topic. My family's from Taiwan and a couple of summers ago, after a mountain of paperwok, I became a dual citizen of USA and Taiwan.

item.description: Projects Here are some projects working off data from countries all around the world: Project 1 Project 2
